text: Didhu is a small village in Pokaran Tehsil of Jaisalmer District of Rajasthan. According to the 2011 census, the village has a population of 1730, out of which 945 are males and 785 are females, and 163 families live in the village. The population of children aged 0-6 is 357 which is 20.64% of the total village population. According to the Constitution of India and the Panchayati Raj Act, Didhu is administered by the Panchayat Ajasar Sarpanch, who is the representative of the village and the Panchayat. Didhu village government and private schools. == References == Category:Villages in Rajasthan
title: Didhu
